item.title: Signing Forms in the Age of COVID
item.description: Paper Forms in a Contactless Age We recently spoke to a school principal who was distributing iPads and laptops to students to help them with distance learning. The form he had to use required the signature of the student, the parent, and a school employee, ensuring close contact with three different people. “In a time when we need to limit contact with others, three of us signing a form, potentially with the same pen, seems careless,” he said.
